bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of yu chang qi 育腸氣 , birth intestine qi. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi bing 百 病主治病 , shan qi 疝氣 , elevation-illness qi: 女子育腸，小兒木腎 , “ Birth intestine [qi] in females ; testicles [as hard as] wood in children”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi bing 百病主治病 , shan tui 疝㿉 elevation-illness and prominence-illness: 腹病曰疝，丸病曰㿉。有寒氣，濕熱，痰積，血滯，虛冷。男子奔 豚、女子育腸、小兒木腎 , “When the illness affects the abdomen, it is called ‘elevation-illness’. When it effects the testicles, it is called ‘prominence-illness’. [Its different manifestations] include ‘cold qi’, ‘moisture heat’, ‘phlegm accumulation’, ‘blood sluggishness’, ‘depletion cold’, ‘running piglets’ in males, ‘ birth intestine [qi] in females ’, and testicles as hard as wood in children”.
